Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Partnering with local environmental organisations and engaging the community, Qantas Airways has mobilised teams of volunteers to comb through the beaches of Bali, meticulously collecting and properly disposing of plastic waste and other debris. This initiative aligns with Qantas' commitment to sustainability and reflects a broader dedication to environmental stewardship.
column20: Clean up of Bali beaches, Employee Volunteering, Jetstar Bali

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: As the official airline partner of Paralympics Australia, Qantas plays a crucial role in facilitating Paralympic athletes' travel to international competitions, ensuring seamless and accessible journeys. This partnership extends beyond logistical support, emphasising the shared values of determination, resilience, and the pursuit of excellence.
column20: Paralympics Australia, Inclusion plan, employee volunteering

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The partnership between Qantas Airways and Football Australia underscores the airline's dedication to sports and highlights the significance of fostering a strong sense of national Pride and unity through football. column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Qantas engaged the services of specialist First Nations consultancy 15 Times Better to complete a comprehensive review of the Qantas Group's First Nations engagement activity. It resulted in developing an overarching Qantas Group First Nations Engagement Strategy to guide our First Nations-focused activities across Qantas, Jetstar, Qantas Freight and Qantas Loyalty businesses.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In FY23, we announced a partnership with Indigenous water company Yaru Water Australia to supply water to first and business-class customers in our Australian lounges. Yaru Water is sourced and bottled from Mount Warning-Wollumbin in Bundjalung in Northern New South Wales.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: We include acknowledgment of country across all Qantas and Jetstar services, with a specific admission for incoming Qantas international flights, Qantas domestic flights to particular ports, and some Jetstar flights. The Acknowledgement of Country is aimed at raising awareness of the history of our country among our employees and customers and making this recognition a part of our everyday language.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The airline transports humanitarian aid, medical supplies, and relief personnel to areas impacted by natural disasters, conflicts, or emergencies. Qantas' logistical expertise and swift response contribute to the efficiency and effectiveness of international relief efforts, aiding in rapidly deploying resources to those in need.
column14: Qantas and Jetstar flew 12 pallets of humanitarian supplies to Singapore to support recovery efforts. Our aircraft carried blankets, quilts, sleeping bags, tents, air mattresses and pillows out of Melbourne, connecting with Turkish Airlines who took the supplies to their destination.
column20: International relief, regional communities, devastating earthquakes

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: StarKids raises funds through customer donations while booking flights on our Jetstar website, collections on board our flights and public offerings via the StarKids page on our website. We also raise funds via Workplace Giving and fundraising activities at Jetstar Head Office and across our ports in Australia, Singapore, Denpasar and Bangkok.
column14: Between 2007 and 2023, the StarKids partnership between World Vision and Jetstar has raised more than $12 million for children and families
